name: aquasecScanner
author: aquasec
helpMarkDown: This task scans a Docker image for security vulnerabilities and compare it against an image assurance policy. You should add this task after a step that builds a Docker image and before a step that pushes the image to a registry.

inputs.name: image
inputs.label: Image name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The image to scan. Can be a static name, e.g. myapp/myimage:4, or a variable based name, e.g. $(Build.Repository.Name):$(Build.BuildId)

inputs.name: register
inputs.label: Register
inputs.helpMarkDown: Register the image in the Aqua console.

inputs.name: hideBase
inputs.label: Hide base image vulnerabilities
inputs.helpMarkDown: Hide vulnerabilities in the base image.

inputs.name: windowsScannerVersion
inputs.label: Scanner Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select 6.5.0 to use the embedded scanner for 6.5.0 version. Select Artifacts to use the scanner binaries from Azure DevOps Artifacts service.

inputs.name: scanner
inputs.label: Aqua Scanner Image Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Change this field to use a non default version of the Aqua Scanner.

inputs.name: registry
inputs.label: Registry
inputs.helpMarkDown: Scan an image in a Registry.

inputs.name: connection
inputs.label: Aqua Management Console Connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: The Aqua Management Console connection. click the Manage link and create a new Generic Service Endpoint, enter the Aqua Management Console url, e.g. `https://server.example.com`, and required credentials.

inputs.name: composefile
inputs.label: Docker Compose File
inputs.helpMarkDown: The Docker compose file(s) containing the images to scan. Can be a static name, e.g. myapp/myimage:4, or a variable based name, e.g. $(Build.Repository.Name):$(Build.BuildId)

inputs.name: dockerarchivefile
inputs.label: Tar File Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path of the tar file to scan. Must be a fully qualified path or relative to $(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory).

inputs.name: notCompliesCmd
inputs.label: Shell command to execute when no compliance
inputs.helpMarkDown: When image doesnâ€™t comply with Aqua policy command to execute when no compliance.

inputs.name: scanMalware
inputs.label: Collect malware files when scanning image.

inputs.name: showWillNotFix
inputs.label: Show vulnerabilities that will not be fixed.

inputs.name: registerCompliant
inputs.label: Register the image in the Aqua Server only if is determined to be compliant.
